ProbeAction.ScriptBody:
'Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
'************************************************************************* ' $ScriptName: "SystemNetworkManagementFirewallRules" $ ' ' Purpose: This script execute different Firewall Rules Actions. ' ' $File: SystemNetworkManagementFirewallRules.vbs $ '*************************************************************************
Option Explicit SetLocale("en-us")
'Event Constants Const EVENT_TYPE_SUCCESS = 0 Const EVENT_TYPE_ERROR = 1 Const EVENT_TYPE_WARNING = 2 Const EVENT_TYPE_INFORMATION = 4 'Other constants Const SCRIPT_NAME = "SystemNetworkManagementFirewallRules" ' Event ID Constants Const EVENTID_SUCCESS = 98 Const EVENTID_SCRIPT_ERROR = 3000 Const ScriptOpctionEnable = "2" Const ScriptOpctionShowState = "3" Const NET_FW_IP_PROTOCOL_ICMPv4 = 1 Const NET_FW_IP_PROTOCOL_UDP = 17 Const NET_FW_IP_PROTOCOL_ICMPv6 = 58
Dim fwPolicy2, strRuleState, oParams, oAPI Dim strOpc, strSnmpPort, strTrapPort, strAppName Dim ObjError, strMessageToUse
Set oAPI = CreateObject("Mom.ScriptAPI")
Set oParams = WScript.Arguments
if oParams.Count < 4 then strMessageToUse = "The script '" & SCRIPT_NAME & "' didn't execute successfully because some parameters were missing: Param Count(" & CStr(oParams.Count) & ")" CreateEvent EVENTID_SUCCESS, EVENT_TYPE_INFORMATION, strMessageToUse End if
strOpc = oParams(0) strSnmpPort = oParams(1) strTrapPort = oParams(2) strAppName = oParams(3)
Set ObjError = New Error On Error Resume Next
Set fwPolicy2 = CreateObject("HNetCfg.FwPolicy2")
ObjError.Save On Error Goto 0
If ObjError.Number <> 0 Then strMessageToUse = "Fail Creating FW Policy Object - Error Number: " & ObjError.number & " Error Details: " & ObjError.Description CreateEvent EVENTID_SUCCESS, EVENT_TYPE_INFORMATION, strMessageToUse End If
call ExecuteRuleAction(strOpc, strAppName) WScript.Quit
Sub ExecuteRuleAction(strOpc, strApplicationName) Dim rule, RulesObject
set RulesObject = fwPolicy2.Rules
for each rule in RulesObject if rule.ApplicationName=strApplicationName and (rule.Protocol=NET_FW_IP_PROTOCOL_ICMPv4 or rule.Protocol=NET_FW_IP_PROTOCOL_ICMPv6 or (rule.Protocol=NET_FW_IP_PROTOCOL_UDP and (rule.RemotePorts=strSnmpPort or rule.LocalPorts=strSnmpPort or rule.LocalPorts=strTrapPort))) then Select Case strOpc Case ScriptOpctionEnable strRuleState = EnableRule(rule) WScript.Echo(strRuleState)
Case ScriptOpctionShowState strRuleState = GetState(rule) WScript.Echo(strRuleState) End Select end if next End Sub
Sub CreateEvent(lEventID, lEventType, strMessage) oAPI.LogScriptEvent SCRIPT_NAME,lEventID, lEventType, strMessage WScript.Echo(strMessage) WScript.Quit End Sub
Function GetState(ruleToCheck) Dim strRuleState
if ruleToCheck.Enabled then strRuleState = "Rule " & ruleToCheck.Name & " is Enabled" else strRuleState = "Rule " & ruleToCheck.Name & " is Disabled" end if GetState = strRuleState End Function
Function EnableRule(ruleToEnable) Dim bIsEnabled Dim strRuleState Dim ObjErr, strMessageToUse
Set ObjErr = New Error On Error Resume Next
ruleToEnable.Enabled = true
ObjErr.Save On Error Goto 0
If ObjErr.Number <> 0 Then strMessageToUse = "Fail Enabling Rule " & ruleToEnable.Name & " - Error Number: " & ObjErr.number & " Error Details: " & ObjErr.Description CreateEvent EVENTID_SUCCESS, EVENT_TYPE_INFORMATION, strMessageToUse End If
bIsEnabled = ruleToEnable.Enabled
ObjErr.Save On Error Goto 0
If ObjErr.Number <> 0 Then strMessageToUse = "Fail Enabling Rule " & ruleToEnable.Name & " - Error Number: " & ObjErr.number & " Error Details: " & ObjErr.Description CreateEvent EVENTID_SUCCESS, EVENT_TYPE_INFORMATION, strMessageToUse End If
if bIsEnabled then strRuleState = "Rule " & ruleToEnable.Name & " was Enabled Successfully" else strRuleState = "Fail to Enabled Rule " & ruleToEnable.Name end if EnableRule = strRuleState End Function
Class Error Private m_lNumber Private m_sSource Private m_sDescription Private m_sHelpContext Private m_sHelpFile Public Sub Save() m_lNumber = Err.number m_sSource = Err.Source m_sDescription = Err.Description m_sHelpContext = Err.HelpContext m_sHelpFile = Err.helpfile End Sub Public Sub Raise() Err.Raise m_lNumber, m_sSource, m_sDescription, m_sHelpFile, m_sHelpContext End Sub Public Sub Clear() m_lNumber = 0 m_sSource = "" m_sDescription = "" m_sHelpContext = "" m_sHelpFile = "" End Sub Public Default Property Get Number() Number = m_lNumber End Property Public Property Get Source() Source = m_sSource End Property Public Property Get Description() Description = m_sDescription End Property Public Property Get HelpContext() HelpContext = m_sHelpContext End Property Public Property Get HelpFile() HelpFile = m_sHelpFile End Property End Class

DisplayString.Name: Trap Received (Cisco Reload)
DisplayString.Description: Launches a discovery when a Cisco Reload trap is received

DisplayString.Description: Creates an event for the SNMP Trap ciscoEnvMonShutdownNotification when received from a Cisco network device

DisplayString.Description: Creates an event for the SNMP Trap demandNbrLayer2ChangeTrap, indicating an interface state change.

DisplayString.Description: Creates an event for the SNMP ColdStart trap when received from a network device

DisplayString.Name: Trap Received (Warm Start)

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Microsoft System Center Network Management Monitoring: This management pack contains workflows and monitors for monitoring the health and availability of network components.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor is the rollup monitor for responsiveness to ICMP or SNMP. If one or more of the subordinate monitors is in a warning state, this monitor will also be in a warning state.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: A warning state for this monitor indicates that the target network device is not responding to either ICMP or SNMP ping messages.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to determine which subordinate monitor is causing the failure. See the knowledge article for the failed monitor for more information on the specific failure.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor is the rollup monitor for the health state for memory. If one or more of the subordinate monitors is in a warning state, this monitor will also be in a warning state.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: A warning state for this monitor indicates a memory warning state in one or more monitored interfaces.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to determine which subordinate monitor is causing the failure. See the knowledge article for the failed monitor for more information on the specific failure.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor is the rollup monitor for the health state of the packet discard rate. If one or more of the subordinate monitors is in a warning state, this monitor will also be in a warning state. A subordinate monitor enters a warning state if the number of discarded input or output packets exceeds the configured threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: A warning state for this monitor indicates one or more monitored interfaces is experiencing a high input or output discard rate.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to determine which subordinate monitor is causing the failure. See the knowledge article for the failed monitor for more information on the specific failure.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor is the rollup monitor for the health state of the queue drop rate. If one or more of the subordinate monitors is in a warning state, this monitor will also be in a warning state. A subordinate monitor enters a warning state if the number of dropped packets as a result of a full input or output queue exceeds the configured threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: A warning state for this monitor indicates that one or more monitored interfaces is experiencing a high number of dropped packets as a result of a full input or output queue.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to determine which subordinate monitor is causing the failure. See the knowledge article for the failed monitor for more information on the specific failure.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor is the rollup monitor for the health state of the packet error rate. If one or more of the subordinate monitors is in a warning state, this monitor will also be in a warning state. A subordinate monitor enters a warning state if the number of input or output packet errors exceeds the configured threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: A warning state for this monitor indicates that one or more monitored interfaces is experiencing a high percentage of input or output packet errors.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to determine which subordinate monitor is causing the failure. See the knowledge article for the failed monitor for more information on the specific failure.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor is the rollup monitor for the health state of the administrative and operational status of monitored interfaces. If one or more of the subordinate monitors is in a warning state, this monitor will also be in a warning state.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: A warning state for this monitor indicates that one or more monitored interfaces is either administratively or operationally disabled, or else in an unknown or unexpected state.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to determine which subordinate monitor is causing the failure. See the knowledge article for the failed monitor for more information on the specific failure.

The values of an interface's AdminStatus and OperStatus attributes are used to determine the state of the interface. When the value of AdminStatus is healthy, the value of OperStatus determines the state of the interface. Otherwise, the value of AdminStatus determines the state of the interface.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of memory fragmentation on this memory pool. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The largest free memory buffer percentage is greater than the threshold.
Error: The largest free memory buffer percentage is below the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value
The largest free buffer percentage below which the memory is considered fragmented

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters an error state when the system memory on this device is highly fragmented. The largest free memory buffer percentage is compared to the threshold (the default threshold is 10). The largest free memory buffer percentage is calculated by taking the largest contiguous memory buffer in the pool compared to the remaining free memory in the pool.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the largest free memory buffer percentage measured that caused the health state to change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of memory fragmentation on this memory pool. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The largest free memory buffer percentage is greater than the threshold.
Error: The largest free memory buffer percentage is below the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value
The largest free buffer percentage below which the memory is considered fragmented

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters an error state when the system memory on this device is highly fragmented. The largest free memory buffer percentage is compared to the threshold (the default threshold is 10). The largest free memory buffer percentage is calculated by taking the largest contiguous memory buffer in the pool compared to the remaining free memory in the pool.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the largest free memory buffer percentage measured that caused the health state to change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the current operational status of a port on this device. This monitor has three possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: a port on this device is connected and functional
Warning: a port on this device is in an unknown state
Error: a port on this device is disconnected, not functional, or administratively disabled

maml:section.maml:para: The values of a port’s AdminStatus and OperStatus attributes are used to determine the state of the interface. When the value of AdminStatus is healthy, the value of OperStatus determines the state of the interface. Otherwise, the value of AdminStatus determines the state of the interface.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: An error state for this monitor indicates that the port is not responding to requests, and was not taken offline intentionally by an administrator. A warning state indicates that the port status is unknown.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the Object Identifier (OID) and the value that the device returned in response to the query. maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the current administrative status of a port on this device. This monitor has three possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: a port on this device is administratively enabled
Warning: a port on this device is in an unknown state
Error: a port on this device is administratively disabled

maml:section.maml:para: The values of a port’s AdminStatus and OperStatus attributes are used to determine the state of the interface. When the value of AdminStatus is healthy, the value of OperStatus determines the state of the interface. Otherwise, the value of AdminStatus determines the state of the interface.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: An error state for this monitor indicates that the port is not responding to requests, and was taken offline by an administrator. A warning state indicates that the port status is unknown.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the Object Identifier (OID) and the value that the device returned in response to the query. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for the device's specific OID for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of memory fragmentation on this memory pool. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The largest free memory buffer percentage is greater than the threshold.
Error: The largest free memory buffer percentage is below the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value
The largest free buffer percentage below which the memory is considered fragmented

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters an error state when the system memory on this device is highly fragmented. The largest free memory buffer percentage is compared to the threshold (the default threshold is 10). The largest free memory buffer percentage is calculated by taking the largest contiguous memory buffer in the pool compared to the remaining free memory in the pool.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the largest free memory buffer percentage measured that caused the health state to change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:para: The values of an interface's AdminStatus and OperStatus attributes are used to determine the state of the interface. When the value of AdminStatus is healthy, the value of OperStatus determines the state of the interface. Otherwise, the value of AdminStatus determines the state of the interface.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: An error state for this monitor indicates that the interface is not responding to requests, and was not taken offline by an administrator. A warning state indicates that the interface status is unknown.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the Object Identifier (OID) and the value that the device returned in response to the query. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for the device's specific OID for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates that a duplicated IP address is detected on the network. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: No duplicate IP addresses are detected.
Warning: A duplicate IP address has been detected.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: There is no configuration for this monitor

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor indicates a warning if more than one interface has been detected using the same IP address.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to determine the interfaces using the duplicate IP address.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor uses SNMP to determine whether the monitored network device is available. The monitor queries to test whether the network device is able to respond to a basic SNMP request in a timely manner. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: the target network device is responding to SNMP requests
Warning: the target network device is not responding to SNMP requests

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: A warning state for this monitor indicates that the target network device is not responding to SNMP requests.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: An error state for this monitor indicates that the port is not responding to requests, and was not taken offline intentionally by an administrator. A warning state indicates that the port status is unknown.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the Object Identifier (OID) and the value that the device returned in response to the query. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for the device's specific OID for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor indicates the responsiveness of the IP target to an ICMP ping message. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: the target network device is responding to ICMP ping messages
Warning: the target network device is not responding to ICMP ping messages

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: A warning state for this monitor indicates that the target IP is not responding to ICMP ping messages.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Ensure that the firewall is configured to allow SNMP traffic. Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the Object Identifier (OID) and the value that the device returned in response to the query. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for the device's specific OID for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor indicates the responsiveness of the IPv6 target to an ICMP ping message. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: the target network device is responding to ICMP ping messages
Warning: the target network device is not responding to ICMP ping messages

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value
Size of the ICMP probe packet in bytes

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: A warning state for this monitor indicates that the target IPv6 network device is not responding to ICMP ping messages.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Verify that the device is online and configured to respond to ICMP pings. Verify that the ICMP from all monitoring servers in the network monitoring pool are capable of sending a ping to the device. Verify that the firewall on all monitoring servers in the network monitoring pool is configured to allow ICMP ping inbound and outbound.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor indicates the responsiveness of the IP address for a specific network device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: the IP address is responding to ICMP ping messages
Error: the IP address is not responding to ICMP ping messages

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value
Size of the ICMP probe packet in bytes

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: An error state for this monitor indicates that the target IP address is not responding to ICMP ping messages.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Verify that the device is online and configured to respond to ICMP pings. Verify that the ICMP from all monitoring servers in the network monitoring pool are capable of sending a ping to the device. Verify that the firewall on all monitoring servers in the network monitoring pool is configured to allow ICMP ping inbound and outbound.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the percentage of collisions on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The percentage of collisions is below the threshold.
Warning: The percentage of collisions exceeds the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters a warning state when the rate of collisions exceeds the collision threshold. The default threshold is 10.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:para: The values of an interface's AdminStatus and OperStatus attributes are used to determine the state of the interface. When the value of AdminStatus is healthy, the value of OperStatus determines the state of the interface. Otherwise, the value of AdminStatus determines the state of the interface.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the percentage of broadcast packets received on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The percentage of broadcast packets is below the threshold.
Warning: The percentage of broadcast packets exceeds the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters a warning state when the input packet broadcast percentage on the network device is greater than the configured threshold. The input packet broadcast percentage calculates the percentage of total capacity that was used to receive broadcast packets. The default is 20.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of discarded input packets on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The number of discarded packets is below the threshold.
Warning: The number of discarded packets exceeds the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters the warning state when the percentage of discarded input packets is greater than the discard threshold. The input packet discard percentage is derived by dividing the rate of input packets discarded by the rate of packets received.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of input packet errors on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The number of input packet errors is below the threshold.
Warning: The number of input packet errors exceeds the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters a warning state when the percentage of input packet errors is greater than the error threshold configured for this interface (the default is 10%). The input packet error percentage is derived by dividing the number of input packets in error by the total number of input packets. The result of this calculation is expressed as a percentage and compared to the error threshold.

The input packet rate must be greater than or equal to the minimum packet rate. The minimum packet rate is derived by dividing the speed of the interface by the value of its maximum transfer unit (MTU) and multiplying the result by the error traffic threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the number of discarded input packets on this device due to queue overflow. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The number of discarded input packets is below the threshold.
Warning: The number of discarded input packets exceeds the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters a warning state when the number of packets discarded due to input queue overflow exceeds the queue drop threshold (the default is 1). The input queue overflow is derived by dividing the number of packets designated to be received that were discarded due to queue overflow by the total number of packets in the queue.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of output packet errors on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The number of output packet errors is below the threshold.
Warning: The number of output packet errors exceeds the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters a warning state when the percentage of output packet errors is greater than the error threshold configured for this interface (the default is 10%). The output packet error percentage is derived by dividing the number of output packets in error by the total number of output packets. The result of this calculation is expressed as a percentage and compared to the error threshold.

The output packet rate must be greater than or equal to the minimum packet rate. The minimum packet rate is derived by dividing the speed of the interface by the value of its maximum transfer unit (MTU) and multiplying the result by the error traffic threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: this interface is connected and functional
Warning: this interface is in an unknown state
Error: this interface is disconnected, not functional, or administratively disabled

maml:section.maml:para: The values of an interface's AdminStatus and OperStatus attributes are used to determine the state of the interface. When the value of AdminStatus is healthy, the value of OperStatus determines the state of the interface. Otherwise, the value of AdminStatus determines the state of the interface.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: An error state for this monitor indicates that the interface is not responding to requests, and was not taken offline by an administrator. A warning state indicates that the interface status is unknown.

maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the percentage of broadcast packets received on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The percentage of broadcast packets is below the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded

Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters a warning state when the input packet broadcast percentage on the network device is greater than the configured threshold. The input packet broadcast percentage calculates the percentage of total capacity that was used to receive broadcast packets. The default is 20.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:section.maml:title: Summary

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The number of discarded input packets is below the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the percentage of the total capacity on this device used to receive broadcast packets. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The percentage of broadcast packets is below the threshold.
Warning: The percentage of broadcast packets exceeds the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value
Percentage of capacity used to receive broadcast packets

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters a warning state when the input packet broadcast percentage exceeds the broadcast threshold (the default threshold is 20).

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of input packet errors on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The number of input packet errors is below the threshold.
Warning: The number of input packet errors exceeds the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters a warning state when the percentage of input packet errors is greater than the error threshold configured for this interface (the default is 10%). The input packet error percentage is derived by dividing the number of input packets in error by the total number of input packets. The result of this calculation is expressed as a percentage and compared to the error threshold.

The input packet rate must be greater than or equal to the minimum packet rate. The minimum packet rate is derived by dividing the speed of the interface by the value of its maximum transfer unit (MTU) and multiplying the result by the error traffic threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the current administrative status of this device. This monitor has three possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: a port on this device is administratively enabled
Warning: this interface is in an unknown state
Error: this interface is administratively disabled

maml:section.maml:para: The values of an interface's AdminStatus and OperStatus attributes are used to determine the state of the interface. When the value of AdminStatus is healthy, the value of OperStatus determines the state of the interface. Otherwise, the value of AdminStatus determines the state of the interface.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: An error state for this monitor indicates that the device is not responding to requests, and was taken offline by an administrator. A warning state indicates that the port status is unknown.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the Object Identifier (OID) and the value that the device returned in response to the query. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for the device's specific OID for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

When the value of AdminStatus is healthy, the value of OperStatus determines the state of the interface. Otherwise, the value of AdminStatus determines the state of the interface.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: An error state for this monitor indicates that the interface is not responding to requests, and was taken offline by an administrator. A warning state indicates that the interface status is unknown.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the Object Identifier (OID) and the value that the device returned in response to the query. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for the device's specific OID for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of processor utilization on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The percentage of processor utilization is below the threshold.
Error: The percentage of processor utilization exceeds the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value
Percentage of the overall capacity of the processor being used

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters an error state when the processor utilization level on the network device is greater than the configured threshold. The utilization is expressed as a percentage of the overall capacity of the processor. The default is 90%.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of processor utilization on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The percentage of processor utilization is below the threshold.
Error: The percentage of processor utilization exceeds the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value
Percentage of the overall capacity of the processor being used

maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters an error state when the amount of free memory on the interface is less than the configured threshold. The default is 15%

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the current operational status of this interface. This monitor has three possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: this interface is connected and functional
Warning: this interface is in an unknown state
Error: this interface is disconnected, not functional, or administratively disabled

maml:section.maml:para: The values of an interface's AdminStatus and OperStatus attributes are used to determine the state of the interface. When the value of AdminStatus is healthy, the value of OperStatus determines the state of the interface. Otherwise, the value of AdminStatus determines the state of the interface.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: An error state for this monitor indicates that the interface is not responding to requests, and was not taken offline by an administrator. A warning state indicates that the interface status is unknown.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the Object Identifier (OID) and the value that the device returned in response to the query. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for the device's specific OID for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of processor utilization on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The percentage of processor utilization is below the threshold.
Error: The percentage of processor utilization exceeds the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value
Percentage of the overall capacity of the processor being used

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters an error state when the processor utilization level on the network device is greater than the configured threshold. The utilization is expressed as a percentage of the overall capacity of the processor. The default is 90%.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the percentage of used memory on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The percentage of memory used is below the threshold.
Error: The percentage of memory used exceeds the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters an error state when the number of buffers used exceeds the Memory Buffer Utilization Threshold (the default is 90).

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters an error state when the processor utilization level on the network device is greater than the configured threshold. The utilization is expressed as a percentage of the overall capacity of the processor. The default is 90%.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of processor utilization on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The percentage of processor utilization is below the threshold.
Error: The percentage of processor utilization exceeds the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value
Percentage of the overall capacity of the processor being used

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters an error state when the processor utilization level on the network device is greater than the configured threshold. The utilization is expressed as a percentage of the overall capacity of the processor. The default is 90%.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of utilization on this interface. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The percentage of network utilization is below the threshold.
Warning: The percentage of network utilization exceeds the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters a warning state when the utilization level for this interface exceeds the configured threshold. The current utilization of a port or interface is the ratio, expressed as a percentage, of the total number of bits sent over some interval over the total number of bits that could have been sent in that same interval. A value of 100% means that, had more traffic arrived in that period, some would have been dropped due to lack of capacity.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters a error state when the number of buffers used exceeds the Memory Buffer Utilization Threshold (the default is 90).

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of processor utilization on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The percentage of processor utilization is below the threshold.
Error: The percentage of processor utilization exceeds the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value
Percentage of the overall capacity of the processor being used

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters an error state when the processor utilization level on the network device is greater than the configured threshold. The utilization is expressed as a percentage of the overall capacity of the processor. The default is 90%.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of free memory on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The percentage of free memory used is greater than the threshold.
Error: The percentage of free memory used is below the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters an error state when the amount of free memory on the interface is less than the configured threshold. The default is 15%

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This dependency monitor rolls up the connection state of monitored interfaces. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: All monitored interfaces are connected.
Warning: At least one interface is unavailable.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor shows a warning if one or more interfaces of the network connection have an unhealthy state.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to determine the status of disconnected interface and resolve the issue.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor rolls up the file system performance status of monitored network devices. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The file system utilization level of all monitored network devices is within the configured threshold.
Error: The file system utilization level of at least one network device has exceeded the configured threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor shows an error if one or more file system components has excessive utilization.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to determine the status of the network device experiencing file system utilization issues and resolve the issue.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor rolls up the memory performance status of monitored network devices. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The performance of all memory components is within the configured threshold.
Error: The performance of at least one memory component has exceeded the configured threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor shows an error if one or more memory components has either insufficient free memory or high buffer utilization.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to determine the status of the network device experiencing memory issues and resolve the issue.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor rolls up the processor performance status of monitored network devices. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The performance of all processor components is within the configured threshold.
Error: The performance of at least one processor component has exceeded the configured threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor shows an error if one or more processor components has an issue.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to determine the status of the network device experiencing processor issues and resolve the issue.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This dependency monitor rolls up the availability state of the network devices in the monitored VLAN. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: All network devices in the VLAN are available.
Error: At least one network device in the VLAN is unavailable.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor shows an error if one or more of the network devices in the VLAN is unavailable.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to determine the status of the network device that is unavailable and resolve the issue.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This dependency monitor rolls up the availability state of the HSRP Endpoints in the monitored HSRP Group. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: At least one HSRP endpoint in the HSRP group is available.
Error: All HSRP endpoints in the HSRP group are unavailable.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor shows an error if all of the HRSP endpoints in the HSRP group are down.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to determine the status of the HSRP endpoints that are down and resolve the issue.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This dependency monitor rolls up the redundancy state of the HSRP Group. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: All HSRP endpoints in the HSRP group are available.
Error: One or more HSRP endpoints in the HSRP group not healthy.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor shows an error if all of the HRSP endpoints in the HSRP group are down.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to determine the status of the HSRP endpoints that are down and resolve the issue.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the health status of an interface with a service access point layered over it. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: All interfaces for the service are healthy.
Warning: One or more interfaces for the service are unhealthy.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: One or more of the interfaces used by this service are in an unhealthy state.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to determine which interfaces are in an unhealthy state and resolve the issue.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor rolls up the health status of all the network discovery servers in the management group. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: All network discovery servers are healthy.
Warning: One or more network discovery servers is unhealthy.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: One or more of the network discovery servers in this management group is in an unhealthy state.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to determine which network discovery server is in an unhealthy state and resolve the issue.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule launches a discovery when a trap is received indicating that a card has been inserted in a 3Com interface.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule launches a discovery when a trap is received indicating that a module has been inserted in a 3Com interface.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule launches a discovery when a trap is received indicating that the configuration of a Cisco interface has changed.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule launches a discovery when a trap is received indicating that a configuration management event has occurred on a Cisco interface.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule launches a discovery when a trap is received indicating that a Cisco field-replaceable unit (FRU) has been inserted in a Cisco interface.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule launches a discovery when a trap is received indicating that a Cisco field-replaceable unit (FRU) has been removed in a Cisco interface.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule launches a discovery when a trap is received indicating that the status of a module in a Cisco interface has changed.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule launches a discovery when a Reload trap is received on a Cisco interface.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule collects the current utilization of a network interface. The current utilization of a port or interface is the ratio, expressed as a percentage, of the total number of bits sent over some interval over the total number of bits that could have been sent in that same interval. A value of 100% means that, had more traffic arrived in that period, some would have been dropped due to lack of capacity.
