maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule creates an event for the SNMP cHsrpStateChangeTrap when received from a Cisco device.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule creates an event for the SNMP Trap ciscoEnvMonShutdownNotification when received from a Cisco device.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule creates an event for the SNMP demandNbrLayer2ChangeTrap, indicating an interface state change.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule creates an event for the SNMP ColdStart trap when it is received from a network device.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule creates an event for the SNMP WarmStart trap when it is received from a network device.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule creates a synthetic heartbeat for a network device so that monitors can determine the status of the network device. This rule should not be disabled.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This discovery rule populates the Relay Network Adapter Group by including all discovered relay link ports or interfaces.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This discovery rule populates the All Network Monitoring Group by including all discovered network devices and components.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This discovery rule populates the ICMP-only Group by including all discovered network devices in the network that are monitored only by ICMP.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This discovery rule populates the SNMP-only Group by including all discovered network devices in the network that are monitored only by SNMP.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Monitor type with Two states, event based, with percentage check and manual reset state.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Network Devices were unable to be discovered and are in pending management.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: Network Devices in pending management can be caused by an issue with SNMP credentials supplied, intermittent network latency or unexpected blockage of SNMP traffic.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Check to ensure your SNMP credentials supplied during Network Discovery are still valid. Ensure firewall rules are not blocking SNMP access to the devices being monitored. Contact your network administrator for additional troubleshooting.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The SNMP trap port (162) is already in use by another program

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: In order to monitor network devices and collect SNMP traps, the SNMP trap port needs to be used exclusively. If other SNMP services are currently using the port this can cause issues.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Uninstall or disable other SNMP services.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The recovery task will enable the ICMP and SNMP firewall rule exceptions to allow the Network Monitoring feature to monitor network devices over the specified protocols

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Probe module type to execute a specific script to obtain a property bag with network management firewall rules states.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Write Action module type to execute a specific script to apply an action in network monitoring firewall rules.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The network discovery rule failed to execute. Please check your network discovery rule.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This discovery rule populates a group with all of the network connections that have been discovered.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule collects the rate of Ethernet packet collisions on the interface.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the percentage of collisions on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The percentage of collisions is below the threshold.
Warning: The percentage of collisions exceeds the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters a warning state when the rate of collisions exceeds the collision threshold. The default threshold is 10.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule collects the number of input packet errors, expressed as a percentage of the total number of input packets.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the current operational status of this interface. This monitor has three possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: this interface is connected and functional
Warning: this interface is in an unknown state
Error: this interface is disconnected, not functional, or administratively disabled

maml:section.maml:para: The values of an interface's AdminStatus and OperStatus attributes are used to determine the state of the interface. When the value of AdminStatus is healthy, the value of OperStatus determines the state of the interface. Otherwise, the value of AdminStatus determines the state of the interface.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: An error state for this monitor indicates that the interface is not responding to requests, and was not taken offline by an administrator. A warning state indicates that the interface status is unknown.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the Object Identifier (OID) and the value that the device returned in response to the query. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for the device's specific OID for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of memory fragmentation on this memory pool. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The largest free memory buffer percentage is greater than the threshold.
Error: The largest free memory buffer percentage is below the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value
The largest free buffer percentage below which the memory is considered fragmented

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters an error state when the system memory on this device is highly fragmented. The largest free memory buffer percentage is compared to the threshold (the default threshold is 10). The largest free memory buffer percentage is calculated by taking the largest contiguous memory buffer in the pool compared to the remaining free memory in the pool.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the largest free memory buffer percentage measured that caused the health state to change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of free memory on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The percentage of free memory used is greater than the threshold.
Error: The percentage of free memory used is below the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters an error state when the amount of free memory on the interface is less than the configured threshold. The default is 15%

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of free memory on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The percentage of free memory used is greater than the threshold.
Error: The percentage of free memory used is below the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters an error state when the amount of free memory on the interface is less than the configured threshold. The default is 15%

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule retrieves the size of the largest number of contiguous bytes from the memory pool that are currently unused, expressed as a percentage of the free memory in the memory pool.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of input packet errors on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The number of input packet errors is below the threshold.
Warning: The number of input packet errors exceeds the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters a warning state when the percentage of input packet errors is greater than the error threshold configured for this interface (the default is 10%). The input packet error percentage is derived by dividing the number of input packets in error by the total number of input packets. The result of this calculation is expressed as a percentage and compared to the error threshold.

The input packet rate must be greater than or equal to the minimum packet rate. The minimum packet rate is derived by dividing the speed of the interface by the value of its maximum transfer unit (MTU) and multiplying the result by the error traffic threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

The output packet error percentage is derived by dividing the number of output packets in error by the total number of output packets. The result of this calculation is expressed as a percentage and compared to the error threshold.

The output packet rate must be greater than or equal to the minimum packet rate. The minimum packet rate is derived by dividing the speed of the interface by the value of its maximum transfer unit (MTU) and multiplying the result by the error traffic threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. maml:section.maml:para: This rule collects the number of output packet errors, expressed as a percentage of the total number of output packets.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the current operational status of a port on this device. This monitor has three possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: a port on this device is connected and functional
Warning: a port on this device is in an unknown state
Error: a port on this device is disconnected, not functional, or administratively disabled

maml:section.maml:para: The values of a port’s AdminStatus and OperStatus attributes are used to determine the state of the interface. When the value of AdminStatus is healthy, the value of OperStatus determines the state of the interface. Otherwise, the value of AdminStatus determines the state of the interface.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: An error state for this monitor indicates that the port is not responding to requests, and was not taken offline intentionally by an administrator. A warning state indicates that the port status is unknown.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the Object Identifier (OID) and the value that the device returned in response to the query. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for the device's specific OID for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of processor utilization on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The percentage of processor utilization is below the threshold.
Error: The percentage of processor utilization exceeds the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value
Percentage of the overall capacity of the processor being used

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor enters an error state when the processor utilization level on the network device is greater than the configured threshold. The utilization is expressed as a percentage of the overall capacity of the processor. The default is 90%.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Use the Health Explorer to check the details for the state change on the State Change Events tab for the monitor. This data shows the calculated performance counter value that caused the health state change. Consult the device manufacturer's documentation for more information on the problem and troubleshooting procedures.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The monitor indicates the level of processor utilization on this device. This monitor has two possible states:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Healthy: The percentage of processor utilization is below the threshold.
Error: The percentage of processor utilization exceeds the threshold.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: The following options can be configured on this monitor:

maml:entry.maml:para: Amount of time in seconds between checks of the device status
Number of attempts in each monitoring interval before the interval's sample is discarded
Number of consecutive samples before the monitor changes state
Amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a response from the device before the sample times out and a new attempt is made to sample the value
Percentage of the overall capacity of the processor being used
